description: Represents a series of barges with standardized dimensions, draft calculations, and tonnage specifications for a customer

properties.name: BargeSeriesID
properties.description: Unique identifier for the barge series

properties.name: CustomerID
properties.description: Foreign key reference to the customer who owns this barge series

properties.name: HullType
properties.description: Single character code identifying the hull type of the barge

properties.name: CoverType
properties.description: Code identifying the cover type for the barge

properties.name: Length
properties.description: Length of the barge in feet

properties.name: Width
properties.description: Width of the barge in feet

properties.name: Depth
properties.description: Depth of the barge in feet

properties.name: TonsPerInch
properties.description: Tonnage capacity per inch of draft

properties.name: DraftLight
properties.description: Light draft of the barge (draft when empty) in feet with decimal precision

properties.name: DraftLightFeet
properties.description: Calculated property: Feet portion of DraftLight converted from decimal feet to feet and inches format

properties.name: DraftLightInches
properties.description: Calculated property: Inches portion of DraftLight converted from decimal feet to feet and inches format

properties.name: IsActive
properties.description: Indicates whether this barge series is active

childCollections.name: BargeSeriesDrafts
childCollections.description: Collection of draft specifications with tonnage values at different inch increments

businessRules.message: Hull type exceeds maximum length of 1.
Cover type exceeds maximum length of 3.
Light draft (ft/in) must be between 0 and 99.999.
All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.
businessRules.context: When any BargeSeriesDraft child has tonnage values
businessRules.description: Iterates through all BargeSeriesDraft children and validates that all Tons00 through Tons11 fields are non-negative. Only shows the broken rule once even for multiple negative values.

factory.name: NewBargeSeries
factory.description: Creates a new BargeSeries instance with default values

factory.name: NewBargeSeriesAsChild
factory.description: Creates a new BargeSeries instance as a child object

fetch.name: GetBargeSeries
fetch.description: Loads an existing BargeSeries by ID

fetch.name: GetBargeSeriesChild
fetch.description: Loads an existing BargeSeries as a child object by ID

fetch.name: GetBargeSeriesChild
fetch.description: Loads an existing BargeSeries as a child object from a data reader
fetch.implementation: Creates instance via reflection, calls LoadProperties and LoadChildObjects

crud.name: Save
crud.description: Saves the BargeSeries and marks the BargeSeriesList cache as dirty
sideEffects: Marks BargeSeriesList cache dirty if object is dirty

crud.name: SaveNoRefresh
crud.description: Saves the BargeSeries without refreshing the object and marks the BargeSeriesList cache as dirty
sideEffects: Marks BargeSeriesList cache dirty if object is dirty

crud.name: DeleteBargeSeries
crud.description: Deletes a BargeSeries by ID and marks the BargeSeriesList cache as dirty

initialization.name: Initialize
initialization.description: Initializes a new BargeSeries instance with default values and custom display names
logic: Sets display names for CustomerID ('Customer'), Name ('Series'), HullType ('Hull type'), CoverType ('Cover type'), TonsPerInch ('Tons/inch'), DraftLight ('Light draft (ft/in)')

validation.name: CheckBusinessRules

parameters.name: PropertyName
parameters.description: Name of property to validate, or String.Empty to validate all

validation.description: Validates business rules for the specified property or all properties
logic: Validates all BargeSeriesDraft child tonnage values (Tons00-Tons11) are non-negative

validation.name: IsValid
validation.description: Checks if object is valid by validating BargeSeriesDrafts child collection before returning base validity

relationships.description: BargeSeries has multiple draft specifications with tonnage calculations

defaults.description: Barge series is active by default

affectedCaches.description: List cache is marked dirty on any save or delete operation

auditFields.description: Field-level auditing tracks changes to all properties

annotations: [StringLength(1, ErrorMessage = "Hull type exceeds maximum length of 1.")]
[StringLength(3, ErrorMessage = "Cover type exceeds maximum length of 3.")]
[Range(0, 99.999, ErrorMessage = "Light draft (ft/in) must be between 0 and 99.999.")]

rules: RuleFor(x => x.CustomerID).GreaterThan(0).WithMessage("Customer is required.");
RuleFor(x => x.Name).NotEmpty().WithMessage("Series is required.");
RuleFor(x => x.Name).MaximumLength(50).WithMessage("Series exceeds maximum length of 50.");
RuleFor(x => x.HullType).NotEmpty().WithMessage("Hull type is required.");
RuleFor(x => x.HullType).MaximumLength(1).WithMessage("Hull type exceeds maximum length of 1.");
RuleFor(x => x.CoverType).NotEmpty().WithMessage("Cover type is required.");
RuleFor(x => x.CoverType).MaximumLength(3).WithMessage("Cover type exceeds maximum length of 3.");
RuleFor(x => x.Length).NotNull().WithMessage("Length is required.");
RuleFor(x => x.Length).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(x => x.Length.HasValue).WithMessage("Length must be non-negative.");
RuleFor(x => x.Width).NotNull().WithMessage("Width is required.");
RuleFor(x => x.Width).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(x => x.Width.HasValue).WithMessage("Width must be non-negative.");
RuleFor(x => x.Depth).NotNull().WithMessage("Depth is required.");
RuleFor(x => x.Depth).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(x => x.Depth.HasValue).WithMessage("Depth must be non-negative.");
RuleFor(x => x.TonsPerInch).NotNull().WithMessage("Tons/inch is required.");
RuleFor(x => x.TonsPerInch).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(x => x.TonsPerInch.HasValue).WithMessage("Tons/inch must be non-negative.");
RuleFor(x => x.DraftLight).NotNull().WithMessage("Light draft (ft/in) is required.");
RuleFor(x => x.DraftLight).InclusiveBetween(0, 99.999m).When(x => x.DraftLight.HasValue).WithMessage("Light draft (ft/in) must be between 0 and 99.999.");
RuleForEach(x => x.BargeSeriesDrafts).ChildRules(child => {
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons00).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons00.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons01).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons01.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons02).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons02.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons03).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons03.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons04).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons04.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons05).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons05.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons06).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons06.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons07).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons07.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons08).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons08.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons09).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons09.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons10).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons10.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");
child.RuleFor(d => d.Tons11).GreaterThanOrEqualTo(0).When(d => d.Tons11.HasValue).WithMessage("All draft tonnage values must be non-negative.");

notes: BargeSeries uses a custom conversion helper for DraftLight to split decimal feet into feet and inches components
The BargeSeriesDrafts child collection contains multiple tonnage fields (Tons00-Tons11) representing tonnage at different inch increments
All decimal properties (Length, Width, Depth, TonsPerInch, DraftLight) are stored as strings in the legacy system
The IsValid property override ensures child BargeSeriesDrafts validation occurs before returning validity status
Cache management is critical - BargeSeriesList must be marked dirty on all Save/Delete operations
Child tonnage validation iterates through all 12 tonnage fields per draft record but only displays a single error message
DraftFeet child property validation ensures non-negative integer values
